adverb.description: Especially with reference to the use of language: incorrectly, erroneously. Formerly also: †figuratively, loosely; not literally (obsolete). Now rare.
In an inappropriate, unsuitable, or unacceptable manner; to a low or unacceptable standard; improperly.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in John Trevisa (c1342–?1402), translator. From un- + properly, after unproper.
